intro: Gomphandra lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gomphandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short peduncles. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
